column5: Altered frequency (The Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network 2015)

column6: Responds to diverse cellular stresses to regulate expression of genes involved in cell cycle arrest, apoptosis, senescence, DNA repair, or changes in metabolism
column7: Barbieri et al. 2012; Beltran et al. 2016b; Mu et al. 2017

column6: Contributes to prostate cancer by directly activating the transcription of protumorigenic factors involved in cell growth and proliferation
column7: Jenkins et al. 1997; Ellwood-Yen et al. 2003

column6: Required for epithelial cell differentiation in murine prostate and promotes cell cycle progression in CRPC
column7: Zhang et al. 2011a; Barbieri et al. 2012

column6: Tumor suppressor; acts as a downstream effector of the TGFbeta pathway, regulates gene transcription, inhibits epithelial cell proliferation, and remodels the TME
column7: Ding et al. 2011; Wang et al. 2016a

column6: One of the master controllers of the cell cycle checkpoint signaling pathways that are required for cell response to DNA damage and for genome stability
column7: Pritchard et al. 2016; Fraser et al. 2017
